p: Aqueous and hydromethanolic leaves’ extracts led to a viral titer (log 10 CCID50/mL) ranging from 0.00 ( M. alba var. alba) to 2.24 ( M. alba var rosea). As for stem bark extracts, inhibition percentages of the hydromethanolic leaves’ extracts seem higher than the inhibition percentages of the aqueous extracts. Indeed, inhibition percentages of the hydromethanolic leaves’ extracts ranged from 67% ( M. rubra) to 100% ( M. alba var. alba) when inhibition percentages of the aqueous leaves’ extracts ranged from 38.54% ( M. alba var rosea) to 48% ( M. alba var. alba).
